org.orgName: Western District Court of Washington, Northern Division.

div1.p: IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE1/4UNITED STATES, FOR THE WESTERN DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, FOR THE NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of George Alexander Mirianon, for a Writ of Habeas Corpus. FORM OF PAUPERIS

Comes now George Alexander Mirianon, the petitioner in the above entitled case, and informsthe Court that he is absolutely penniless and has not partaken of food for the past two days; that he is restrained of his liberty illegally, wrongfully and unlawfully by the Marshal of the Western District of Washington, or such persons acting by, under or through him, and that it is necessary that he be given a proper hearing as is allowed him by the constitution of the United States and by the treaty regulations between the Republic of France and the United States; that the right be allowed him to file in this court a petition for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and and Order to Show Cause in said action, and that the court further direct the United States Marshal of the Western District of Washington, Northern Division, and the Clerk of this court to file and serve such Order and such Writ of Habeas Corpus in this court.
State of Washington County of King. SS.

GEORGE ALEXANDER MIRIANON, being first and duly sworn, on oath deposes and says: That HE IS THE PETITIONER in the above entitled cause and that he is absolutely penniless; and that he has no means whereby to obtain funds or relief, and that he took the oathe of form of Pauperis after having read said petition, and that the same is true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this day of January, 1914
Notary Public in adn for the State of Washington, residing at Seattle.
IN THE SUPERIOR DISTRICT COURT STATE OF WASHINGTON KING COUNTY
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF GEORGE ALEXANDER MIRANION, FOR A WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS Plaintiff vs. Defendant
FILED IN THE U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, NORTHERN DIVISION JAN 19 1914
div1.ab: Frank L. Crosby, Clerk by EML Deputy
div1.p: BEELER & SULLIVAN Attorneys for Petitioner. 412-416 ARCADE ANNEX SEATTLE, WASHINGTON PHONE: MAIN 907
